2.text: Suffer me a little, and I will show thee that I have yet to speak on Godâ€™s behalf.

3.text: I will bring my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

4.text: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

5.text: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

6.text: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

7.text: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yes, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

8.text: And if they are bound in fetters, and are held in cords of affliction;

9.text: Then he showeth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

10.text: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

11.text: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

12.text: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

13.text: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

14.text: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

15.text: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

16.text: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table would be full of fatness.

17.text: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

18.text: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

19.text: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

20.text: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

21.text: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

22.text: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

23.text: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

24.text: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

25.text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

27.text: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapor of it.

28.text: Which the clouds do drop and distill upon man abundantly.

29.text: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

30.text: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

31.text: For by them he judgeth the people; he giveth food in abundance.

32.text: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the intervening cloud.

33.text: The noise of it showeth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapor.
